answers.answer: i have had it 2 out of 7 pregnancies  and you really need to have your sugars under control I have had to be on insulin one baby was normal weight one was 10 lbs 1 oz  i think for the most part that is why they do the nst non stress test and lots of u/s but im sure that your baby will be ok maybe be born with low blood sugar  but that is easily fixed :) good luck 2 you  Loretta

question: Hey everyone, wow its been a long time since I have been on here.I can not believe that I am 25 weeks :). After all the problems I have had or thought I had. I made it to the 25th week but the sad news is that I was diag with gestational diabetes. "My sugar level is running 180-190". I am nervous about what the diabetes can do to my lil girl growing inside me. I read that it can cause a stillborn, or that the baby can be 10pds at delivery.If anyone has had this experience in their pregnancy please share your story with me.God bless.
title: gestational diabetes
